Luigi Luca Cavalli-Sforza (; 25 January 1922 – 31 August 2018) was an Italian population geneticist. He lectured at Stanford University. Cavalli-Sforza won the Weldon Memorial Prize in 1978. He was born in Genoa, Italy.
Cavalli-Sforza died on 31 August 2018 in Belluno, Italy at the age of 96.
